title: SL ready to scrap para tariffs on imports from US
byline: In its bid to retain access to the U.S. market in the wake of reciprocal tarrifs, Sri Lanka has proposed to do away with para tarrifs on imports from the U.S. , Daily Mirror learns.

title: Reshan to vie at Nick Faldo Asia Finals
byline: Reshan Algama will represent Sri Lanka at the prestigious Nick Faldo Asia Finals 2025 in Vietnam, having received a special Wild Card entry based on his outstanding performances in tournaments through 2024 and early 2025.

title: Strong support from rooftop solar owners amid grid risk: CEB
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said yesterday that many rooftop solar panel owners across the country gave a positive response by agreeing to turn off their systems during the daytime (until 3 p.m.) from April 13 onwards.

title: PHIs assigned for exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ Union (PHIU) has decided to assign at least 50 Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) daily during the upcoming exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Dekma) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa.

title: Court issues order against Indrananda over Thoradeniya’s complaint
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Manjula Rathnayake today issued a conditional restraining order against former Provincial Councilor and Central Committee Member of the Frontline Socialist Party, Indrananda de Silva.

title: Six injured in three-wheeler, bus collision in Dikoya
byline: Six persons, including a thirteen-year-old schoolboy, were seriously injured when the three-wheeler they were travelling in collided with a private bus last night in Dikoya town, on the Hatton–Maskeliya main road, police said.

title: AI-generated clips shared as genuine footage of eroded land bridge between India and Sri Lanka
byline: The Rama Setu -- also known as Adam’s Bridge -- is a series of limestone shoals connecting the Indian mainland and Sri Lanka, but a video shared online with claims it depicts the natural formation under the sea is generated with AI.

title: Stepping out for protection and prosperity
byline: The ritual of ’Stepping Out for Protection and Prosperity’ will take place at 9:03 AM on Thursday, April 17, marking the return to daily routines after the Avurudu festivities.

title: Telescope finds promising hints of life on distant planet
byline: Scientists have found new but tentative evidence that a faraway world orbiting another star may be home to life.

title: Long queue two days ahead of exposition of Sacred Tooth Relic
byline: A long queue of devotees waiting to worship the Sacred Tooth Relic is already forming in Kandy.

title: Student dies after falling from greasy pole
byline: A 16-year-old school student died after falling from a greasy pole while helping to prepare for an Avurudu festival in the Elpitiya area today (17).

title: Tour guide arrested over stabbing during tourist dispute
byline: Another tour guide involved in the stabbing of a fellow guide during a dispute over sharing tourists last evening (16) was arrested by the Kalutara North Police.

title: Locally produced milk, yogurt exempted from VAT under new amendment
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) declared that locally produced liquid milk and yogurt are now exempt from Value Added Tax (VAT), following the enactment of the Value Added Tax Amendment Bill in Parliament.

title: Telescope finds promising hints of life on distant planet
byline: Scientists have found new but tentative evidence that a faraway world orbiting another star may be home to life.

title: Ferry services between Mannar, Rameswaram to commence soon: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that steps will be taken soon to resume ferry services between Mannar and Rameswaram.

title: EC announces revised dates for postal voting for LG polls
byline: The Elections Commission today announced revised dates for the postal voting for the upcoming Local Government elections.

title: 190 complaints received on New Year bus services: NTC
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) said today that it has received around 190 passenger complaints to date regarding private bus services during the New Year season.

title: State Vesak Festival to be held in Nuwara Eliya
byline: The State Vesak Festival is scheduled to be held in Nuwara Eliya from May 10 to 16, Nuwara Eliya District Secretary Thushari Thennakoon said.

title: California becomes first state to sue over Trump tariffs
byline: California Governor Gavin Newsom has filed a lawsuit challenging President Donald Trump’s spate of tariffs that have upended global trade.

title: Reveal perpetrators behind Easter Sunday attacks, Catholic church urges govt.
byline: The Catholic Bishops’ Conference in Sri Lanka, in its special message for Easter stressed that ascertaining who the perpetrators of the Easter Sunday attacks in 2019 were and those who have aided and abetted in the dastardly act, is a matter of urgency.

title: Fresh postmortem on Sathsar Nimesh to be conducted on April 23
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the court that a fresh postmortem examination will be conducted on April 23 on the body of Sathsar Nimesh, who died while in the custody of the Welikada Police.

title: 400,000 more families to receive Aswesuma benefits from June: President
byline: Steps will be taken to provide Aswesuma benefits to 400,000 new families from June this year, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Coroner remanded for accepting bribe
byline: Anuradhapura Municipal Coroner and his assistant were remanded till April 21 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Mohamed Rizwan today over allegations of accepting a bribe of Rs. 2,000 to issue a postmortem report.
